p: In order to investigate seasonal variations in the essential oil composition of S. blancoana subsp. mariolensis and S. officinalis subsp. lavandulifolia, two samples were collected at winter time (SB7 and SL3, respectively). In general, the chromatographic profile of the latter was inside the range found for spring-early summer samples of S. officinalis subsp. lavandulifolia. Nevertheless, in the case of S. blancoana subsp. mariolensis, the essential oil of the winter sample (SB7) showed a significantly higher percentage of 1,8-cineole and a lower percentage of camphor, the two major constituents, when compared to the essential oils from samples collected in late spring-early summer (SB1â€“SB6).
